projectPurpose: Pueue is a command-line task management tool for queuing, managing, and executing shell commands, particularly long-running ones, with features like concurrency control, scheduling, and persistence.
mainFeatures: Queue shell commands for sequential or parallel execution
Run long-running tasks in the background (daemon)
Control the number of tasks running concurrently
Detach from the terminal while tasks continue to run
View output and status of running or finished tasks
Persist the task queue and logs to disk
Schedule tasks to run at a specific time

alternatives.name: at / batch
mainFeatures: Schedule commands for one-time execution at a specific time (at)
Schedule commands to run when system load is low (batch)
Read commands from standard input or a file

alternatives.name: Task Spooler (ts)
mainFeatures: Queue jobs for sequential or parallel execution
Control the number of concurrent jobs
Jobs run in the correct environment

mostWellKnownAlternative: GNU Screen / tmux (for session management and detaching)
Task Spooler (ts) (for command queuing and concurrency control)
marketPositioning: Pueue is positioned as a modern, feature-rich command-line task management tool that provides a robust queuing system for shell commands. It sits between basic scheduling tools like 'at'/'batch' and full-fledged job schedulers, offering more control over concurrency, dependencies, and persistence than simpler alternatives, while focusing on a per-user, single-system model. Its key differentiators compared to direct competitors like Task Spooler include features like task grouping, callbacks, and JSON output, along with being written in Rust.
